data.title: How to set different tabSize for special files?
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: osx 10.11.5

How to set different tabSize for special files? Such as:
- `*.sass` file indent tabSize is 2
- `*.rst` file indent tabSize is 3

data.title: Opening Command Palette is removing the current line' indicator
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Put the cursor in any line, Code indicates the _current line_ with a full line border
2. Opens `Command Palette` (`Ctrl + P`)
3. The _current line indication_ disappears, until you closes the `Command Palette` or any `QuickPick` that you open.

Here is an animated GIF:

![code-insiders-current-line-indicator-disappears](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3781424/15765513/fa653512-290b-11e6-879b-03c7c09acd0c.gif)

I noted this issue in the previous insider version (May 31 I guess). And in the current (June 2nd) also presents the issue.

Thanks in advance

data.title: Feature Request: Open file with an extension scheme
support sharing of launch config attributes between request types

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Many attributes in the `configurationAttributes` section of the debuggers extension point are shared across the different request types 'launch' and 'attach'. Currently they have to be duplicated for the request types.

We should allow for having top-level attributes definitions in the `configurationAttributes` section. They would be shared between the different request types.

data.title: Typescript validation seems to be out of order on Mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  Install VSCode on Mac
2.  Launch VSCode first time and edit any file of your choice
3.  Launch VSCode second time

It works perfectly on my windows machine but on mac the validation seems to be switched off. The tsc also seems to work in strange manner, it can compile any rubbish sort of text (CMD+Shift+B) without notifying me about errors, but tsc from the command line works just perfectly. Same problem with intellisense. Developer Tools neither shows nothing abnormal.

data.title: ExternalTerminal.windowsExec requires tool directory to be on path variable
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Win 10 enterprise preview 14355.rs1_release.160525-1714

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install Git-Bash
2. Change setting to "externalTerminal.windowsExec" : "C:\Program Files\Git\git-bash.exe"
3. Use the context menu 'open in cmd prompt'

Expected behavior:
Git bash opens:

Actual behavior:
Command prompt opens with "C:\Program Files\Git\git-bash.exe" in the title.

Workaround: Change the setting to "git-bash" and adjust the user/system PATH variable to include the program files\git location.

data.title: Visual Studio Code doesn't open when there is an Admin VSCode open
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. launch a command line with admin privileges
2. from this command line, type "code .". Observe VS Code open
3. Launch a command line without admin privileges
4. from this command line, type "code .". 
Expected:
VS Code opens in a new window

Actual:
Nothing, no error message, no indication of anything.

data.title: Adding autocomplete values of to input/select/textarea
data.body:
https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#inappropriate-for-the-control

This allows for lots of great auto completion for forms.

data.title: Problems: automatically expand file nodes similar to search results
data.body: In search we have this logic to automatically expand a file node when it has less than 10 results within. Maybe we apply the same logic to problems?

data.title: Problems: lock the scrollposition when changes happen

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: I think the problems list can be under heavy changes when new markers come in or existing ones are removed. As much as possible I think the current selected entry should remain stable in the same location no matter what happens around.

data.title: Markers: deleting a file should remove its markers
data.body: Currently markers stay.

data.title: Problems: content in tree is not aligned in the center nicely
data.body: Every item in the list has 22px of height but entries do not specify a line-height property of 22px, so the text looks more aligned to the top.

data.title: Problems: embed the search box into the header
data.body: Instead of showing an action to enable the "type to filter", why do we not just embed an input field in the header that you can just start typing? It is possible to contribute actions to the header that heave their own UI. E.g. the dropdown in the debug viewlet or output channel is done like that:

data.title: Problems: there are some behaviour things in trees to consider
data.body:
Our trees typically behave like this:
- clicking with the mouse keeps focus in the tree (see below for explanation)
- double click moves focus to the editor
- Cmd/Ctrl+click opens the editor to the side

You can see this in action e.g. in search: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/browser/searchViewlet.ts#L892

When I use the mouse to click on an entry in the problems list, I would expect focus to remain in the list. It seems you open an editor without specifying the `preserveFocus` option which would keep the focus in the tree.

Of course only use that option when the mouse is used, not on enter. I would also think that doubleclick should move focus into the editor too.

data.title: Problems: there is a padding/margin to the left of the tree
data.body: I would expect the selection to go all the way to the left and right.

data.title: Problems: tree should not be clickable when there are no problems
data.body: Maybe just hide it if you show the message?

data.title: Maximizing the editor in a snap setup causes the interface to not update

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, Build 14352

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Snap a program to the right (I used Groove at minimum width)
2. Snap VS Code to top left
3. Enlarge the window down until Windows snaps it to the top of the taskbar
4. Clicking in the window appears to do nothing until you unsnap the app
5. This does not affect snapping to left, only corner snapping

data.title: Autocomplete on <input> doesn't support autofill values
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  type <input autocomplete=" in an HTML file
2. see only "on" and "off"

There are many more: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/forms.html#inappropriate-for-the-control 

I'm happy to take this on :)

data.title: Allow disabling parameter hints
data.body: Related to #2972

data.title: VSCode Doesn't Automatically Use System Proxy

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install VSCode behind a firewall configured via a pac file
2. Try to install a C# extension
3. Fail
4. Uninstall and use something else

The system admin has disabled the settings in IE via Group Policy so I can't work out what the pac is and as such can't work out the proxy to put in the config.

VSCode should just use the system proxy settings by default and ask for a username/password if necessary.
There should still be manual options for proxies in the config, however, it would also be useful for someone to have the option to specify a pac file too if for some reason the auto detection doesn't work.

data.title: Enhance git commit message (show a counter with (50 - commit message length))

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am using VSCode on Ubuntu 14.04 x64

VSCode About:

Version 0.10.10
Commit 5b5f4db87c10345b9d5c8d0bed745bcad4533135
Date 2016-03-07T10:30:20.458Z
Shell 0.35.6
Renderer 45.0.2454.85
Node 4.1.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a git repo folder
2. Make a change
3. Go the "GIT" tab
4. Start typing a git message

I am thinking of a counter starting with 50 (The number of character that'll be used as the short message appearing in git commits), it helps write meaning full messages, without have a word cut and completed in the description part, the behavior is taken as is from GitKraken

- Type `y u no close?`
- Press <kbd>Enter</kbd>

Breakpoint shows up and goes back to its rename state instantly. I can only get out of it by pressing <kbd>Escape</kbd>

data.title: Error list: filter needs more UX love
data.body:
Open the error list filter and notice:
- input box has a black outline - seems out of style compared to our other input boxes
- input box pushes the tree lower - leaving the space above the tree empty. I find this strange and not elegant
- 'Type to Filter' seems like a strange message, in the find widget we just say 'Find' not 'Type to Find'

![screen shot 2016-06-02 at 15 06 54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/15745733/b311a8fe-28d3-11e6-9683-3c70fa38ec8f.png)

ping @stevencl @bgashler1
